results.mitigation: Close or secure the FTP port if it's not required. If required, ensure strong authentication and encryption.
Use HTTPS instead of HTTP to encrypt data in transit, and implement security headers.
Reduce the amount of information disclosed in HTTP headers. Modification of header values to avoid disclosing unnecessary details about the server.
Ensure that only necessary HTTP methods (GET, POST, etc.) are allowed and unnecessary methods are restricted.
Where feasible, transition to TLSv1.3 for better security. Ensure TLSv1.2 is also updated to the latest supported versions from the OpenSSL library.
Disable insecure and weaker ciphers. Ensure that only strong and recommended ciphers are supported.
Update to a more secure version of OpenSSL that mitigates CVE vulnerabilities.
Update 'Feature-Policy' to 'Permissions-Policy'. Modernize your security headers for better compliance and support with modern browsers.
Disable SSLv2, SSLv3, TLSv1.0, TLSv1.1. Ensure no TLS compression is supported.
